text.p: -- Goldman Sachs analyst Michael Parekh raised his 1997 revenue estimate for Netscape Communications Corp to $546.4 million from $535.2 million previously.
-- Analyst says fourth quarter results were in-line with Wall Street's consensus estimates, with no negative surprises as some had forwarned.
-- Parekh notes new product cycle set to boost second half of 1997, says visibility will increase as products roll out. -- Retains Netscape on Goldman's U.S. Recommended List.
-- Share up 5/8 at 38-5/8 in active mid-morning trade.

-- Analyst cites company's "good progress" in growing its server business, which rose to 33 percent of revenues in fourth quarter from 25 percent in third quarter, while client software was 51 percent of revenues, down from 59 percent in the third quarter, and services was unchanged at 17 percent.
-- says raised first quarter 1997 revenues estimate to $116.7 million from $115.8 million, reflecting expectation of nominal sequential growth of one percent from fourth quarter.

-- Analyst says if Netscape can execute on technical, marketing and support requirements in next two quarters it "will be in the strongest product position in its short history by the second half of this year.
